Dear Tia M. Cobb:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Nabiha Rizk, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On or about 9/15/24, Staff 1 hit Youth A on the back of the head
as the youth were running away. Youth A was seen by a nurse
and there were no concerns.
Investigation This complaint was assigned on 09/18/2024 and investigated in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist.
Administrator 1 was interviewed via telephone on 09/18/2024.
Administrator reported she was informed by Administrator 2 of the
incident involving Youth A going after Staff 1 and Staff 1 reacting
by hitting Youth A on the back of his head. Staff 1 has been
placed on administrative leave pending the investigation.
JJ Worker was interviewed via telephone on 09/18/2024. JJ
Worker reported Youth A has a history of assaulting staff and
peers. Youth A has been at the facility for one month, and she
does not have any concerns for the facility.
Administrator 2 was interviewed at the facility on 09/19/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Administrator 2 was onsite
on 09/15/2024 and she was notified of the incident by Supervisor.
Supervisor reported to Administrator 2 she went to give Staff 1 a
bathroom break and that’s when Youth A ran inside upset with
Staff 1 for not allowing him to come back inside. Youth A swung at
Staff 1 and that’s when Staff 1 hit Youth A on the back of the
head. Supervisor and Staff 2 intervened and separated them.
Youth A was not injured. Administrator 2 spoke with Youth A after
the incident and Youth A denied being injured and did not require
any medical care. Youth A has been instigating many fights with
other youths and she has been allowing Youth A to have extra
time alone in the recreation room to get him to calm down. She
2

said Youth A is 6’5 tall and that can be intimidating, but Staff 1
should not have engaged with Youth A when he was escalated.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 09/19/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Supervisor reported on the
day in question Staff 1 was outside in the courtyard with youths on
the pod. Staff 1 called for a bathroom break, so she and Staff 2
went to the courtyard. She opened the courtyard door and that’s
when Youth A pushed through and entered the hallway. Staff 1
followed and entered the hallway. Youth A went up to Staff 1 and
said, “I should beat your ass.” Supervisor said Staff 1 told Youth A
to go ahead and swing at him and that’s when Youth A swung at
Staff 1, however she did not see if he made contact because she
was facing Youth B. She and Staff 2 attempted to separate Youth
A and Staff 1 and that’s when Staff 1 hit Youth A on the back of
the head. Supervisor had Staff 2 take Youth A to the library to
calm down. Supervisor reported Youth A is easily triggered when
he does not get his way and can be very aggressive.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 09/19/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth A has been at the
facility for one month. Youth A reported on the day in question he
was outside in the courtyard with Staff 1. Youth A was agitated
with other youths that were outside. He asked Staff 1 to call a
supervisor and Staff 1 would not do so, so he was upset with Staff
1. When Supervisor opened the facility door, and he ran inside
and told Supervisor he was going to beat Staff 1 up. Youth A
admitted he swung at Staff 1 and Staff 1 hit him on his head.
Youth A said Supervisor and Staff 2 separated them and was
taken to the library. He denied getting injured or hurt. Youth A
denied any previous incidents involving Staff 1. Youth A reported
he feels safe at the facility and all his needs are being met.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 09/19/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Youth B was in the
courtyard with Youth A, however he denied witnessing the incident
that occurred in the hallway. Youth A did not express any
concerns regarding Staff 1 or the facility.
Staff 1 was interviewed at the facility on 09/25 /2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 1 is a youth worker
and has been working at the facility for almost three months. Staff
1 completed all new hire training including Mandt des-escalation
training in August of 2024. Staff 1 reported on the day in question
he was in the courtyard with the youths on the pod. He said Youth
A had been agitated and had been arguing with him because he
3

wanted to go inside. Staff 1 called Supervisor, so that he could
take a bathroom break. When the Supervisor opened the door of
the courtyard, Youth A ran inside. Staff 1 also went inside and
that’s when Youth A ran up to Staff 1 and swung several times at
him, hitting Staff 1 in the face, so Staff 1 hit Youth A on the head.
Youth A continued to swing at him again and that’s when
Supervisor and Staff 2 blocked and walked Youth A away from
Staff 1. He said Youth A is a difficult youth and is easily triggered if
he does not get his way and will throw things and become very
aggressive. Staff 1 admitted he overreacted in this situation and
should have walked away from Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 10/11/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist. Staff 2 is a youth specialist
and has been working at the facility for two months. Staff 2
recalled the incident involving Youth A and Staff 1. She and
Supervisor were going to relieve Staff 1 for a bathroom break,
when Supervisor opened the door Youth A ran inside upset with
Staff 1, because Staff 1 would not call a supervisor for him. Youth
A ran up to Staff 1, told Staff 1 he was going to hit him, and Staff 1
told him to go ahead and hit him. She and Supervisor had to stand
between Youth A and Staff 1 to prevent them from fighting. She
said the situation became heated very fast, Youth A punched Staff
1 in the face and Staff 1 hit Youth A on the back of his head. She
and Supervisor separated Youth A, and she took Youth A to the
library. She denied Youth A reported being hurt or having any
injuries.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of September 15, 2024. In the hallway leading to
the ‘courtyard approximately 6:17 pm and ends at 6:19 pm (video
has no audio). Supervisor and Staff 1 opened the door to the
courtyard, Youth A ran inside, Staff 1 followed behind Youth A,
Youth A turned and said something to Staff 1, Supervisor and
Staff 1 positioned themselves between Staff 1 and Youth A. There
is a lot of shuffling and pushing, however it is difficult to see if
Youth A or Staff 1 made contact with one another. Youth A is
seen escorted by Staff 2 and Staff 1 walking in the opposite
direction.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 09/15/2024 written by Administrator 2
is consistent with Administrator 2’s interview.
• Staff 1 personnel file, there was no disciplinary record and
Staff 1 completed all required training including crisis
4

intervention verbal and physical de-escalation on
07/15/2024 and 07/16/2024
• Facility’s Youth Discipline and Behavior Modification Policy:
Policy notes the facility prohibits cruel and unusual
punishment including any type of physical discipline.
• MDHHS report indicates findings.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted, video footage reviewed, and
documentation reviewed, this violation is established regarding
Staff 1 hitting Youth A on the back of the head.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024SIC0001229 dated 5/16/2024.
Approved CAP is pending.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.

sir_summary.summary: A staff member at the Calumet Center juvenile facility struck a youth in the back of the head during a physical altercation on September 15, 2024. The incident began when the agitated youth ran inside, threatened the staff member, and swung at him, with reports indicating the youth struck the staff member first; the staff member admitted he overreacted and should have walked away. The investigation, which included interviews and video review, substantiated that the staff member hit the youth, constituting a violation of rules prohibiting physical punishment. Culpability lies primarily with Staff 1 for his retaliatory action, though the facility also bears responsibility as this was a repeat violation, indicating a failure to ensure compliance with behavior intervention policies.
